data.value: These are key words used to provide search results

data.value: **You must first remove all child categories**

data.value: Files are listed in this category

data.name: RemoveCat.Text

data.name: SecurityRoles.Text
data.value: Check Roles that will have access to the files in this category

data.name: lblPageHelp.Text
data.value:
File Category Help

Categories provide three major features:
  1. To organize files you upload to File Share into groups and secure them.
  2. To connect to the Amazon S3 Cloud where you can store files and list them here in the OnyakTech File Share module. To sign up for the Amazon S3 Services, go to http://aws.amazon.com
  3. To list files that already exist on a specific folder on your network by setting the UNC Patch for the Category. When using the UNC Path, a File Share Scheduler will sync the files between the folder and File Share and these files do not get the same security features other files in File Share have. To create a sub-category, first select the category you want to add sub-categories to before creating a new category.
    • To display a list of files from a folder in your local portal: Click the "Set to the local Portal Root" link. This will set the local folder path of the current portal. You can then modify to access a sub-folder. Then just provide a name for your Category and click Save. File Share will import all files and display for download

Additional Display Options are in the Module Settings.

Attribute Help

Adding Attributes to a Category allow you to collect additional information about each file group as they are added and updated. The File Group Attributes are displayed to the users while viewing the File Group in the download detail view.

Attributes are managed through the Attribute Manager and available portal wide to be assigned to Categories.

Category vs. File Group vs Files

Each Category can contain multiple File Groups and each File Group can contain multiple Files. On the main view of this module you will see a list of entries (these are File Groups) and selecting one will show you the details of that File Group and all files available for download in that File Group. While viewing a File Group you can download individual files or add all files to your "File Bundle". The File Bundle is a collection of files you have selected for download; clicking on "My File Bundle" will show you all of the files you have selected and from that screen you can download all selected files in a single zip file.

Categories are managed here and displayed on the main view. On the main view you can "Submit New File" that creates a new File Group where you upload the first file of a File Gruop and assign a Category. After you save the File Group you are then asked to provide Attribute details if the Category you assigned to the File Group has Attributes assigned to it.

data.name: lblAWSAccessKeyId.Help
data.value: If you have an Amazon Simple Storage Service Account then enter the Access Key ID here to have the files accessible from this category. Otherwise leave this field empty.

data.name: lblAWSSecretAccessKey.Help
data.value: If you have an Amazon Simple Storage Service Account then enter the Secret Access Key here to have the files accessible from this category. Otherwise leave this field empty.

data.value: Type User Name to Authorize User

data.value: The Attribute could not be assigned to the active Category. Please select the Category from the Category list on the left and try again.
